title: Convert Pandora client to TypeScript + Effect
Phase 0: Fixture System
description: Record/replay system to avoid hitting Pandora servers during development. Includes fixture directory structure, save/load utilities, and fixture-aware HTTP client.

title: Cleanup: Delete old JS files
description: Remove index.js, index.v*.js, utils.js, blowfish.js, methods/auth.js, bun.lock, package-lock.json after conversion complete.

title: Setup Commander.js CLI structure with global options
description: Initialize CLI with commander, add global options (--json, --no-cache, --config, --verbose, --quiet), setup subcommand groups (auth, stations, playlist, config)

title: Implement YAML config file support with XDG paths
description: Add YAML config loading from ~/.config/pandora/config.yml with fallback to ~/.pandora/config.yml. Support auth credentials, output prefs, cache settings, playlist defaults. Include 'config show', 'config path', 'config init' commands.

title: Implement session caching with TTL
description: Cache session tokens to ~/.cache/pandora/session.json with configurable TTL (default 1hr). Support --no-cache flag to bypass. Handle cache invalidation on auth errors and logout.

title: Implement auth commands (login, logout, status)
description: auth login: credential resolution (CLI args → env vars → config → interactive prompt). auth logout: clear cached session (--all for full clear). auth status: show current auth state with expiry info.

title: Implement stations commands (list, info)
description: stations list: show all user stations with --sort (name/created/recent) and --limit options. stations info: get detailed station info by ID or partial name match. Support both human-readable and JSON output.

title: Implement playlist get command
description: playlist get station: retrieve tracks with --quality (high/medium/low), --format (urls/full/m3u), --additional-url options. Support station lookup by ID or partial name. Output track info with audio URLs.

title: Implement dual output formatting (human-readable + JSON)
description: Create output formatter that supports human-readable tables/text and JSON (--json flag). JSON format: success, data, error. Human format: formatted tables with headers. Include M3U and URL-only formats for playlist.

title: Implement CLI error handling with exit codes
description: Map Effect errors to CLI exit codes: 0=success, 1=general, 2=invalid args, 3=auth failed, 4=network, 5=config error, 6=not found, 7=API error. Show helpful error messages with suggestions.

title: Phase 1: Project Setup
description: Create directory structure, update package.json (ESM, Effect deps), create tsconfig.json, set up .env.local structure.

title: Phase 2: Type Definitions
description: Create TypeScript types for config (PandoraConfig, DeviceKey), API request/response types, and Effect-based error types.

title: Phase 3: Blowfish Conversion
description: Convert blowfish.js to TypeScript with proper type annotations. Create crypto utilities wrapping encrypt/decrypt with Effect.

title: Phase 4: Configuration
description: Create constants.ts with API URL and device keys. Create config.ts with Effect Config layer for environment variables.

title: Phase 5: API Layer
description: Implement API call utilities, auth methods (partnerLogin, userLogin), user methods (getStationList), and station methods (getPlaylist).

title: Phase 6: Main Client
description: Create src/client.ts with PandoraSession type and high-level functions: login, getStationList, getPlaylist.

title: Phase 7: Public API
description: Create src/index.ts exporting all public types, error classes, client functions, and config layer.

title: Phase 8: Example Usage
description: Create examples/basic.ts demonstrating login, station list, and playlist retrieval with Effect.
